Describe Form: Change PPPL's Default Publisher

comments.body:
With PR #1453 the publisher defaults correctly:
* for records migrated via the "Migrate PPPL Dataset" button and 
* for new submissions created by users with only access to the PPPL group

New submissions for users with access to *more than one group* will still have "Princeton University" as the default publisher.

comments.body:
Even with a `git rebase` this still seems to be failing, I will need to attempt to diagnose this with some additional commits. I apologize:

https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/990/workflows/1eedbc4b-a89e-4e81-990b-d6c1d10c7ef0/jobs/3530

pdc_discovery.title: Display related identifiers that are DOIs as links
Remove MaRC boilerplate bc we do not use MaRC
DOI should point to PDC Discovery URL for a work
Newly approved works from Describe are not appearing in the index on Discovery

comments.body:
I reindexed locally using production as the source data from DataSpace and PDC Describe and got all 17 PDC Describe records. I tried several combinations (clear the Solr and reindex, don't clear Solr and reindex) and in every case I got all 17 PDC Describe records.

I re-ran the reindex in production and all 17 records came through, but I did see 15 before I reindex!

```
$ cd /opt/pdc_discovery/current
$ bundle exec rake index:research_data
```

 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

@hectorcorrea I don't know why this would be the case, but indeed when I run `rake index:research_data` I get all of the PDC Describe records, but when I only run `rake index:pdc_describe_research_data` I don't.

I'm going to update the reindex accordingly so we'll see new PDC records faster.

@bess we might be running into the same problem we had before in which one of the replicas was getting the data but not the other. The fast reindex `rake index:pdc_describe_research_data` does not blow away the Solr collection but the slow one `rake index:research_data` does. 

So maybe my "great" idea of using the fast one on the every 30 minutes cronjob is not that great after all 🙃
